name: Mango Raspberry Goji Chia Pudding
description: Indulge in a delightful, healthy treat with our Mango Raspberry Goji Chia Pudding. Perfect for those following a low-sodium, high-fiber diet, this pudding is not just a feast for your tastebuds but also a powerhouse of nutrition. Embark on a journey to wellness with this easy-to-make, delicious pudding that's sure to become a staple in your healthy recipe collection.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix the chia seeds and goji berries with almond milk. Stir well until fully combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Cover the bowl with a lid or plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight, or at least for 4 hours, to allow the chia seeds to absorb the almond milk and thicken.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the almonds and set aside. Peel and dice the kiwi. Thaw the raspberries if using frozen and chop the mango into small pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Once the chia pudding has set, give it a good stir to ensure the consistency is even. If the pudding is too thick, you can add a little more almond milk to reach your desired consistency.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Layer the chia pudding in serving glasses or bowls with the sliced almonds, diced kiwi, raspberries, and mango pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the Mango Raspberry Goji Chia Pudding immediately or keep it refrigerated until ready to serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6
